alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 26 at 3:23PM MST until August 26 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR APACHE COUNTY... At 321 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has ended over the the warned area, between Saint Johns and Springerville. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lyman Lake State Park and Lyman Lake. This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 393 and 401. Highway 180 191 between mile markers 373 and 392. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Vigil Run, Carnero Creek, Nutrioso Creek, Big Hollow Wash, Little Colorado River, Lower Lyman Ditch and Coyote Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
